subject: Photography
title: What Is a Stop of Light?
description: A 60-second lesson on What Is a Stop of Light?.

hook.text: Photographers talk about 'stops' constantly. One stop means doubling or halving the light. That's it.

buildup.text: Going from ISO 200 to 400 is one stop up ‚Äî double the sensitivity. From 1/500 to 1/250 is one stop ‚Äî double the time.

discovery.text: Stops let you compare wildly different settings on one simple scale. It's photography's universal unit.

twist.text: F-stop numbers seem random ‚Äî f/2, f/2.8, f/4 ‚Äî but each step halves the light. The math is hidden in the geometry.

climax.text: Once you think in stops, exposure becomes intuitive. Lose a stop here, gain it there. Balance maintained.

punchline.text: A stop is just doubling or halving. Simple ‚Äî once you know.

quiz.question: What does one 'stop' of light represent?
options: A doubling or halving of the amount of light
